channel.title: Cache Saving Method
channel.description: Hello, I was looking through the 523 client, and i can't seem to find where it saves the cache. In the previous clients, it used a method that saved it into a directory either named ".jagex_cache_" + i, or ".file_store_" + i; However, in the 523, i haven't been able to find it at all. I've found where it pull the "user.home" property, and chased a few leads on RandomAccessFiles, byte[]'s and even a DataInputStream, but have wound up empty handed. Any other leads you can think of? It seems to reference Class139 in some way, but im not sure.

item.title: Cache Saving Method
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

which loader? the loader.java from the loader_gl-1349494298.jar? or something else in the deobbed client?

EDIT: Found it in the kn.java class of the loader_gl-1349494298.jar.

Read full topic

item.title: Cache Saving Method
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Hello, I was looking through the 523 client, and i can’t seem to find where it saves the cache. In the previous clients, it used a method that saved it into a directory either named “.jagex_cache_” + i, or “.file_store_” + i; However, in the 523, i haven’t been able to find it at all. I’ve found where it pull the “user.home” property, and chased a few leads on RandomAccessFiles, byte[]'s and even a DataInputStream, but have wound up empty handed. Any other leads you can think of? It seems to reference Class139 in some way, but im not sure.

Read full topic
